attributes.action: force all companies which accept payment by means other than direct debit to charge ONLY what it costs to process these payments.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I am a customer of a Cable television company; I choose not to pay my bill by direct debit because I feel it puts far too much power in the hands of the payee and any mistake may not be discovered for some time. Another point is, of course, that some people don't hold bank accounts; where does this policy leave them? (And they tend to be the poorer members of society who can least afford these fees).  

I pay these bills by cash and yet I am charged £5 a month for this; surely it can't cost the company anything like that much to process these payments.  Why should I, and everyone else, have to pay these excessive charges just because we choose (in what is supposed to be a free country) not to pay by direct debit?
